Great size & weight to stick in your pocket, but enough settings to totally control your image, not just a bunch of modes. Been waiting for a point & shoot with a viewfinder.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: In a previous review I stated that this camera has one useful feature in an articulating LCD. I was wrong: It does not have this useful feature. Sorry for the confusion. The camera itself does not live up to its potential in any aspect: It is slow-handling and has a next-to-useless optical viewfinder. It must be held at arm's length like Mom does for shots of the kids, definitely not like someone trying to do street photography. An articulating LCD would partially rectify this problem. The controls are fiddly-small and often can't be used in bright sunlight without a hood for the screen. If you're serious about your photography then buy something else.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Almost a P7100 with firmware update ...
Item.Review: OK, it doesn't have the articulating screen and the second command dial as P7100 but for a lot less, I can live with it. Firmware 1.2 fixes pretty much all the software issues that plagued this much maligned but capable camera. It should really help Nikon and the vendors move the remaining stock of this unloved camera. For me, although I am a Nikon guy, I held out to the bitter end and at one point even considered purchasing a G12, until the price drop and the firmware update. I am extremely happy with this purchase and the performance improvement.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay
I bought this camera last June 6, 2011 & used it during my vac in Czech Rep on Aug 2011 but the Zoom Malfunction! It wouldn't go back in! I tried taking-out the battery, same thing! Good thing there was a Nikon Service Center in Prague & brought it there. However, after fixing it, the Shutter Window wouldn't open fully that my pictures gets shadows on the corners! Wanted to return this product but Adorama wouldn't take it back because they say it is out of Warranty! I tried contacting Nikon USA & told me it's a GRAY MARKET! Now, I am left with a dysfunctional camera nobody wants!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: All good...
Cons: Not neatly pocketable...
I must confess to returning this camera a coupla weeks back when I learned its successor the P7100 was coming out in late September.
I'm a lifelong Nikon shooter and working professional. So when it came time to buy a pocket camera, Nikon was my choice.
The P7000 is a great camera especially now that it has come down a bit in price. Solidly made with more features than the average "picture taker" would ever need.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Well, being a fan of Nikon SLRs and a user for several years, it pains me to have to write a review like this... I carry a 'point-and-shoot' camera, primarily as a back-up, but also in situations where an SLR is too bulky (especially the family vacation) to carry. I use it primarily for snap shots, but also for serious work (landscape/portraits/macro). Although I don't use raw files often on these, I like to have the option available. In the past I have used the Canon G-series, because tbey out performed Nikon and were quicker to navigate. I thought this might have changed with the introduction of the P7000, at least that is what I surmised from all of the reviews. When it came time to upgrade, I hesitantly purchased the P7000. I have used this camera on two separate occasions; one w ... ord describes it, and that word is slow. Slow to start-up; slow to respond; slow to refresh, slow to write (reg. files); slow to focus (if it does focus). Don't get me wrong, this is a nice p&s camera, and does have its positives, but not what you would expect from an advanced camera. This model has not changed my view of Nikon p&s cameras and I will not be keeping it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I think I love this camera, but I'm not sure. I only got to use it for a week and a half before I had to pack it up and send it back to Nikon for repairs. I bought it as a light weight companion to my DSLR and was not let down by the functionality, the picture quality, the control, or the fun. Takes great photos. The problem is, after one week of pampered use, the 'lens cover' began to get stuck at ~50% open when I turned on the camera. This is pretty inexcusable since my 5 year old Canon SD450 still works like a champ and has been to the top of Mt. Fuji, carried daily for over a year, and tossed and shaken around on several trips. So it's been with Nikon now for about 3 weeks, and it seems like it may be there for another 2-3 more. I'm not happy. Love the CAMERA, worried about the ... quality of the lens cover and if this will happen again in the future when it's out of warranty and leave me stuck with a camera that needs to be manually open, when what I wanted was a quick draw. Honestly, if I have to flick the lens covers open with a lens pen or something each time I turn the camera on, this camera is of no use to me. Search the message boards to see if people have the same issues with the Canon G12. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: DSLR functionality
Cons: defective firmware and workmanship.
Purchased this camera before doing research on the web. I have the Nikon D90 and it performs flawlessly, and looked to purchasing a point and shoot camera. The P7000 had perks of an SLR in a point and shoot package. The first P7000 i got had focusing issue in every setting, MASPnAuto, Macro, AF, and infinity. I exchanged the camera for another one and had the same issues. I called Nikon customer service and they had me update the firmware from ver1.0 to ver1.1. The update only removed the "initializing lens, cannot focus" warning, but it still had the same focusing issues. I went online and did a search for "P7000 issues" and found that it was a common issue with other users, along with a dysfunctional lens co ... ver. Nikon makes great cameras, but this particular model is a huge disappointment. :( expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera takes wonderful pictures when it works. The lens cover sticks and does not open fully. Nikon has refused to cover this issue under warranty although the camera is only 7 months old and the issue is clearly documented on several forums. The camera also has had focus issues and freezes up with the only resolution to remove and reinsert the battery. The focus and freeze up issues continued after updating the firmware. Stay away from this one.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have had the P7000 for just over 2 weeks and am very pleased with this purchase. The camera feels sturdy and is a pleasure to hold. I have only shot JPEGs and they look awesome straight out of the camera. I have shot at f/2.8 at ISO 6400 and the noise is very acceptable. Set-up and menus are very sraight-forward. If you have used any Nikon DSLR you won't have any problems. Controls are very user friendly and logically placed. At the current lower price the P7000 is a steal!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a small fully functioned camera with good low light capability to take along whwn I didn't want to tussle with my DSLR. I originally shopped for something with an APS C size sensor. The mirrorless offerings were tempting but just too pricey for my largely point & shoot application. The Fujifilm X100 was really interesting but numerous reported quirks put me off. In the end, it came down to the D7000 and the equivalent Canon. As I have the Nikon DSLR, I know their system. I have the Nikon flashes, and the I like the longer lens. When I saw the price B&H offered, I went for it. It is a very capable camera which produces wonderful images - BUT - it is so sloooooowwwww... in operation that sometimes you just want to shake it! It has often been said that the best camera ... is the one you take with you. I've found myself carrying this one along when I wouldn't have brought the full DSLR gear. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Quality like a Reflex, but small like a compact. I found all the functions used with my old N70 in the new P7000, but the results are better (digital images are really better!). I had only some problems about the auto focus in particular with poor light.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera gives you good results overall. While it's not a shirt-pocket camera, it is easy to carry around at all times; a good alternative to lugging the DSLR around or going without. It seems a little slow in reading some light situations and the autofocus is also a little slow on occasion. The zoom lens allows you to reach out relatively far for a compact, but at f/2.8, it isn't the best low light camera on the market. It is easy to adjust settings and the pictures (RAW) are great.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I keep this camera with me at all times. It's great for capturing the moment with my kids, grandkids and great grandkids. Moments I'd miss because I do not have my DSLR available. It takes great pictures at a resolution I can easily print large enough for my piurposes. Sometimes I wish it would focus faster, but that has not been a show stopper for me. Highly recommended for a general purpose, pocket camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a frequent traveler that flies to a different location once a week and this camera is the perfect balance between size and performance. With this camera, I don't have to carry around my bulky DSLR and lenses while not having to worry about shooting sub-quality photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Steep learning curve. Takes quite a bit of time to master, and it does have its quirks. But you will not find a better all-around, small form camera. Exceptional quality at ISO 100 and very usable imaging as high as ISO 1600, which is remarkable for a small-sensor cam. I would not recommend the P7000 to the casual shooter who simply wants to press a button. This is a camera for the experienced enthusiast or pro who knows how to take a good picture with any camera but who wants full control and flexibility in a near-pocket size tool. In that respect, it succeeds better than any small-sensor camera I have owned to date. At base ISO, the image quality is indistinguishable from my larger, heavier, costly Nikon and Canon DSLRs.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I take most of my pictures in macro to be posted on my web site. After reading professional reviews and comparing photo's from both the Nikon P7000 and the Canon G12, I chose the P7000. Why, because they are close enough to each other, I simply couldn't justify paying over $100.00 more for the Canon. If the price tag was equal, it would be the Canon G12, but they're not equal. I have a hard time understanding why some reviews stated no view finder It's right there on BOTH cameras! Neither the Nikon or the Canon have a 100% acurate view finder. Complaints are also noted about shutter lag. This inherant on both brands. If shutter lag is a problem, one would be better off purchasing a DSLR. Concerning the built in flash: neither the Nikon or the Canon are worth much of anything. S ... olution, get an external flash. For my purpose, it all boiled down to price and picture quality. The Canon IS slightly better in certian areas, but my pocketbook screamed less when I purchased the Nikon P7000. If price is no object, get the Canon G12. It's as simple as that! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Fantastic capabilities and features in a compact unit. Flexible and fully controllable for those wanting to influence their photography while retaining the ease of use that point and Shoot users will find fun. For this last group the easy options of the Scenes options offers additional easy to use capabilities. Would like a buffer or internal memory capable of shooting Continuous in RAW format but that is a minor gripe compared to all of what the P7000 offers in such a compact package. I compared long and hard against the Cannon G12 and went with the P7000 mainly because of the better zoom and faster lens the latter offered. Also I was influence by the fact that I own several Nikon DSLRs and had many accessories that would mate well with the P7000 The P7000 has excellent low light ca ... pabilities and its image quality is superb. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great image quality, slow to write!
Item.Review: I am a Nikon DSLR shooter for many years. My main camera is a D700. I love the controls and picture quality of this camera. I wanted something smaller for portability and the option to shoot RAW,add being able to use Nikon speed lights and it is a winner. Overall I have been very pleased but there is a learning curve with this camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bouught this camera to have as a backup for my Nikon D700 to use it both when I have the camera and when I don't wish to lug it around. The camera does an amazing job for its size and the photos are very sharp. The program modes for closeups etc. work extremly well. I'm glad I bought it and have used it on walks to document architecture ad nature on walks. The hot shoe makes it easy to utilize the speedlight. Great Camera, I wish the zoom was somehow non electronic as I find it difficult to stop at the point I want and either have too much or too little zoom, but compared to other point and shoot cameras, this one is a winner. I did hot buy it for the video, and have not tried this feature.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality
Cons: a bit larger than normal point and shoot camera's
I purchased this camera as a secondary small (compact) alternative to my big DSLR and I have to say. It's one of the best picture quality camera's I've owned. It lives up to my expectations and more for a bit larger than a normal point and shoot. Well worth the extra size and money.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Versatile QR Bracket with Low Mass
Item.Review: Good pictures require great stability regardless of what camera is used. This bracket is smoothly finished and highly versatile. It enables using the P-700 on an Arca Swiss type/Kirk quick release in any position, i.e. vertical, horizontal and in between. The bracket has an extra 1/4-20 threaded hole so the camera can be mounted on any device without removing the L-braket. Also the bracket does not impair removal or insertion of either a battery or a memory card. Finally, the L-bracket does allow vertical positioning with the on-board flash above the lens.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not good if you are running Windows
Item.Review: Nikon's P7000 records Apple QT files when shooting video clips. This crucial fact is [...] not mentioned on the Nikon web site!So, if you ever want to actually watch the video you just shot on a Windows PC, you need to download and install the QT Player for Windows from the Apple web site first, yuck!! And then, all you get for free is their stripped-down QT player that shows the video with the frame around it, in less than full screen size. If you want to watch the video in full screen, as you can easily do with the Windows Media Player, then you need to give money to Apple for an upgraded QT Pro player. Yuck again!!I called Nikon Tech Support this morning about this little trick of theirs, and got connected to a chap who spoke the world's poorest English. Also, he did not know ANYTHING. ... After 20 minutes on the phone, he finally suggested I contact Microsoft Corporation and ask them for a solution to play the QT files using Windows Media Player. I kid you not!We have another Nikon CoolPix that records AVI video clips, no problems to report with that one. Nikon must be taking good cash from Apple now.[...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen is very sharp; Convenient flash; Manual focusing works; Excellent macro photos; Quality photos; Fast Focus; Good low-light capability; Videos are decent; Zoom has good range; Many options; Video sound is good
Cons: Flash a little weak; Touchy zoom speed; Awkward strap eyelets; Need to study manual; A little slow on 2nd shot; Smallish shutter release
I bought the P7000 as a travel camera for work and leisure as an upgrade to a Nikon 995. I have a D70 that is too bulky for most travel. The P7000 takes very sharp photos, and I liked the close-up macro capability, especially when documenting samples during factory or field visits. The image quality is excellent, though I feel the need to slightly push the exposure by +1/2 or +1 to get better detail in the shadows. ...
I have a couple of external Nikon flashes (SB-25 and SB-800). The SB-25 did not work at all; the flash would not fire. The SB-800 was not automatically recognized by the P7000 on "auto", but when I manually set the P7000 to one of the flash modes, it worked fine. The P7000 seems to set the "auto ISO" by metering without the flash, so it is good to manually set the ISO to avoid grain in the resulting images.
I found it necessary to study the manual to reach some of the subtle features that weren't obvious to me from the camera's menus. Overall, I am pleased with the camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We use this camera for quick product shots of jewelry and home good for our etsy shop. it's fairly easy to use, although we had some help with the basics from a photographer friend. We're not photographers at all, just needed a nicer camera than we had. It's nice and small so we can bring it along anywhere for personal use also. We LOVE the video quality. Being able to plug a mic in is great, also. For some reason, the black piece that opens in front of the lens when you turn on, sometimes gets stuck at the bottom and you just have to tap it to go back into place. I'm going to call about this though as I bought the warranty.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Al most everything I wanted in a compact
Item.Review: This camera feels and functions more closely to a DSLR than I had expected. Most of the controls are intuitive and in general have found that this camera is really sophisticated for a compact even with good shutter response time. I wish that the viewfinder covered more of the capture. I only wish it were a little smaller. A little lighter would have been nice but the size makes putting it in a pocket rather difficult. I understand there is a case which I assume would fit on a belt but no one seems to have it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera but a huge potential flaw
Item.Review: This is a wonderful camera. Not just as a point and shoot but any camera. I've used a Canon G9 for about three years and did a lot of reading and decided to get the P7000 as they finally made a p&s to compete with Canon. Very pleased with the G9 but it was weak in low light and very noisey. The P7000 is outstanding in that area. Also the zoom, although not quite as long as my G9 in the long end, gives me 28 compared to G9's 35 mm. The G9 has a few features I wish the P7000 had, but no big deal. A hybrid of the two would be unreal. Hope it happens by one of the two giants. Now the problem: I read in several reviews that the lens protector could get hung up and not fully open when you activated the camera. After about two weeks and many, many open and closes and over a thousand shots, it ... happened to me!. My G9 NEVER did it. Nikon has got to get this annoying problem fixed. It's obviously a design flaw[...] All in all I love the camera and will exchange it and hope my new one won't develop this problem. I would definitely recommend this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've only owned the camera for 2 full days now, but I'm already impressed. I haven't found anything to dislike about it yet, if I ever will, but I am writing from a position of not much use yet. I had originally intended to buy the Canon Powershot G12 before I checked to see if Nikon had something similar, whereupon I found this - basically the same camera as the G12, but for $55 less at B&H. That plus the more powerful zoom pushed me to buy it, and I haven't been disappointed. It is exactly the size, shape and weight I expected it to be - more substantial than the average point and shoot, but much less so than a DSLR. The controls and menu items are easy and intuitive, particularly if you're familiar with Nikon cameras already. The start-up time and lag times are minimal; in fac ... t, the lag, if any, isn't perceptible. It's easy to use manual controls, and the automatic functions are really good. I generally try to avoid using a flash whenever possible, so I did a lot of shooting in the P mode (Program) with auto everyhthing and also with the ISO set to 400, then 800, and with the light meter compensation or whatever it's called set to -1. They all came out very good, with the 800 ISO ones being granier, as one would expect. The lighting came out great; the pictures were clear and in focus, and I could not be happier. If you buy this camera, the chances are you'll be pleased expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A great camera to grow with
Item.Review: I bought two P7000's at Christmas for grown daughters who aspire to take good photographs. One is somewhat experienced, the other a novice. With each passing week, I'm more pleased with this decision. This is a camera that can grow with the owner. In automatic operation, it produces excellent results in most shooting situations. Low light or high contrast situations have presented the opportunity to learn, one or two features at a time. My point is: this is an excellent tool for the beginner that doesn't limit them as their skills increase. Not to mention it reflects every bit of the build quality you expect from Nikon, unlike some of the lower-end Coolpix models available. There is a genuine need for a superior quality digital camera for the shooter that doesn't want to get invol ... ved in the complexity or bulk of a DLSR system, and the P7000 is an outstanding execution of the genre. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Reviewer: Tim the die hard film guy
Item.Review: I bought this camera for one SINGLE REASON: It comes with an optical view finder. The prize was also hard to beat. I resisted digital for as long as I could. So naturally I have issues with the LCD most of the time. When I saw this product I knew it was for me. It turned out to be a pleasure to use and I am very pleased with its Low Light performance. There is much talk about its slow user inter face and the time it takes to write RAW images. I have to say that since I don't shoot raw , this is no problem for me. As far as it's speed in handling user commands--I suppose there are faster cameras out there, but in reality most of us will not notice it. One can update its firmware from Nikon's site if that will help. I have found the video image is not as good as one would hope, mainly the ca ... mera is constantly adjusting its white balance and as a result the video clip is always switching between either too bright or too dark. So for video I use my Lumix DMC-ZS3. I think it is also worth to say that this camera looks bigger on the web than its actual size when you hold it in your hands. So those of you who might think that it is too big can relax a bit. Gave four stars because of video quality.I am very happy with it and I have been a B&H customer for a long time. Two thumbs up! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a pro photographer and loyal to Nikon, and was looking for a 'point and shoot' camera that i could use my nikon flashes on. The P7000 is that and more. It has a solid body and feels like a classic nikon camera. The color balance and exposures are amazing, and the plethora of shooting options does not take away from the camera's user friendly interface.The only complaints I have is that it takes a couple second to process raw files before you can shoot again. This pause is very brief when shooting in jpg mode though. The delay from pressing the shutter to capture is almost non-existant otherwise, very good for this kind of camera. I would also love a fixed aperture of 2.8, but that is mostly unheard of in point and shoots.I also got it for the Hi-def Video, which is awesome as well. I ... haven't tried using an external mic yet but appreciate that capability and will definitely use it.I am overall quite pleased with this purchase, it has many of the features of a DSLR in a smaller and less obtrusive body. [...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Although it has the requisite scene and auto modes this is definitely a camera for an advanced photographer. It's quite complex with a rather steep learning curve but once you get it figured out you can take excellent photos with it. I've printed some to 12.5 x 19 that hold excellent detail and I probably could have gone further. It's not a fast camera by any stretch of the imagination, but if you don't shoot sports or require fast response it works well. The auto focus needs a lot of light to lock on, but the manual focus works well. I've found that it focuses best in macro mode and manual focal point setting. Be sure to upgrade the firmware to 1.1 if it hasn't been done when you buy it as that will increase the raw write speed considerably.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Lots of external controls; Macro; Focal distance
Cons: Speed
I've hiked for a week in Patagonia and I enjoyed the versatility of this camera. I ended up taking a lot of macro photos of the flora and I was super impressed with the result - sharp photos even in poor light conditions. This is the perfect camera for backpacking/hiking and an excellent SLR backup. Even though it is not very fast at processing raw I did not find this to be a serious issue. I'm actually between a 4 and 5 just because I had a problem with the lens cover not opening completely and I had to send it back for repair. I blame the crazy Patagonian winds for that.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: image quality , meaningful image controls
Cons: image noise at high iso , Menu Madness
1st up , upgrade the firmware to 1.1 and skip the speed issues reported from ver 1.0. Its a shame Nikon released the camera with firmware that was not ready for prime time. But the new firmware seems a good step toward making the P7000 a great shooter. I bought This to replace a 5400 that ive taken over 3000 photos with. These cameras can produce slr quality photographs if you are aware of the limitations of a 1.7 sensor (iso). I been using nikon cameras and lenses since the FM and FE days , they've always produced a class act. Cutting the Noise on iso's over 800 and cleaning up the menu tree would be appreciated.. The toy gimmick functions are not for people who buy this class camera ... . Learning to use the collection of control buttons and dials will make it a lot easier to relate to expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The flash works remarkably well for such a small camera. The camera itself is very light and easy to hold. There is definitely a learning curve with all the different buttons and wheels, but if you are already familiar with Nikon it isn't too bad. Has some pretty cool shortcuts for frequent manual settings. Takes awesome pictures on auto. Excellent alternative to carrying a larger camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am practically a life long canon EOS user. This is my first nikon. I am favorably impressed so far. I refuse to buy cameras without viewfinders, but this camera does not get 5 stars due to 2 viewfinder deficiencies. First, you only see 80 percent of your picture. Second, there are no focal points visible through the viewfinder, so you cant tell what you are focusing on unless you look at the screen. So few machines have viewfinders, I suppose you take what you can get. I picked this over the G12 for longer optical zoom range. This beats the heck out of toting the SLR and long piece of glass around for times when you want portability and are not on a serious shoot.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've been a Nikon user dating back to the old Nikon Photomic FTN days. I now use a couple of D3s and have a tidy sum invested in my Nikon system so naturally when the P7000 was released I saw it as the perfect small extra camera to throw in my bag or have with me when I wasn't working a job; you know just casual shooting. Purchased the camera and tested it for a 2 weeks. Outdoor shots were great. Indoor available light ... not too great. Of course with the built-in flash, indoor shots were better but limited unless I slapped on a speed light. Bottom line: This camera has all the bells and whistles and the lens is good but the focus is a bit slow and erratic, the view finder leaves a lot to be desired, and RAW processing is very slow. Decided that all I need is a point and shoot vs a s ... mall camera with DSLR-like options.So I returned the camera for something much smaller, no viewfinder, no RAW, etc. I bought the LUMIX DMC-ZS7 which is essentially the Leica V-LUX 20. Small, lots of options an an incredible Leica DC Vario-Elmar Aspherical lens. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A P&S for a pro's bag
Item.Review: An overall amazing camera for a point and shoot. Requires firmware 1.1 to get all five stars though. The new update fixes focusing problems and slow RAW write speeds. Full manual mode leaves a bit to be desired but the other modes work great. I would use my D7000 for more serious shooting, but for a decent, lightweight companion to use for less important things, the P7000 fits perfectly. I don't recommend using it in super low light interior shots though, as this isn't what this Hybrid P&S is intended for. The controls are perfect and the menus are easy enough to navigate for both the photographer stepping up from a basic P&S and also an SLR user who wants a lightweight backup. Hot shoe is great to use a dedicated flash with, and the pop up flash works great as a fill flash. ... Zoom range is great as well. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love Nikon. I have been using the d300 since it came out and have never regretted my purchase. The P7000 takes very nice pictures...but there are two things that make it unusable for me. #1. I love to shoot raw, but the write time (even with a fast card) makes raw shooting a pain. It takes forever. #2. Auto focus is also painfully slow and inaccurate. Forget about shooting macro. Even with the spot auto-focus the camera simply refuses to focus on close subjects. If you keep trying to take the photo, the camera will eventually re-initialize leaving you to be faced with the same problem. That being said, I love the controls, low light performance, and overall build quality. If I shot mostly jpeg I might even consider keeping it...but alas, it's not for me. Instead, I purchased the ... Lumix LX5. My first panasonic camera and I'm quite happy with it. But I do miss the Nikon build and all the great dials! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The P7000 has worked flawlessly since I received it about 2 weeks ago. I am a professional photographer, so I like the fact that with a turn of a dial I can use the camera on Manual. In manual I like that I have a separate wheel to control both the shutter speed and aperture. The quality of the images is top notch. The only thing I have found that is lacking is the camera's ability to focus in low light. The 2 things that I might wish for on the next generation camera is an info display inside the viewfinder like an SLR. Without the info you have to turn the screen on to adjust the settings. The other thing I would like is the ability to move the focus points. Other than those small things, I have loved the camera. It is also easy for my wife to use. She just puts it on P and take ... s great images. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom-ability when making a video
Cons: a little big
Having once tried my hand at professional photography and using top-notch equipment, I was used to having all the bells and whistles, yet once I became a Nana, I just wanted a lightweight point-and-shoot to use.... After trying a host of small cameras, I decided I wanted to upscale a bit so I got the new Nikon P7000 and absolutely love it. It's lightweight, yet larger than a point-and-shoot. One feature I particularly like is the ability to zoom while making a video.... That's what sold me on this camera over than the Canon G12....

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am skin doctor and need the camera for shooting skin diseases mostly portraits and macros, and publishing them on scientific magazines. I was thinking in buying a SLR camera but it is big, heavy, needs a macro lense and a ring flash, so it would be a lot more expensive. This camera is a perfect option because it is light, easy to move, easy to shoot, and has all the resources to shoot good enough pictures for publishing in medical magazines. I love it for macro pictures because the position of the flash doesn't provoke too much shadow on the subject. Also, the pictures already come with a 300 dpi resolution which is necessary for most of the magazines. For my professional use, I just miss a better resolution in movies to film skin surgery on full hd. So this camera a perfect option for ... doctors or dentists that need to shoot and publish pictures in scientific articles. Besides that is a great camera for recreational uses like shooting on trips and parties. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good camera, just not for me.
Item.Review: I wanted so badly to love this little camera. The write times for files are too slow, the adjustments and the light meter in manual mode are temperamental and hard to see. I wanted this to be a contender to the canon G12, but I like the functionality of the G12 better, the focus and snap time are far better on the G12. I am a Nikon user so I liked it for the menu familiarity. The exposure adjustments were great as well. I wanted a small point and shoot but the more I used it the less I like it. Its not a horrible little camera but I just didn't love it like I wanted to. So its going back. I think I would still recommend the Canon G12 over this no matter how much I wanted Nikon to outshine the G12.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Feature rich, full manual control
Cons: Interface, Slow, Build
The Nikon P7000 is what I've been waiting for, for years... almost.
It's a great camera, but there were too many annoyances with it compared to the Canon G12.
First, the lens cover blades didn't always open all the way which would cause black areas on my photos if I didn't notice it.
Second, Nikon really missed the boat by not adding a control dial to the front of the camera like the G12. I find it much easier to use than the rotary dial on the back of the P7000.
Third, the operating system is slow. It response in relationship to aperture/shutter speed adjustment is lagging and the time from menue to taking a photo is also too cumbersome.
Fourth, I wasn't happy with the res ... ults of the flash (both on camera and off). The Canon seems to nail it better every time.
That said, the camera does produce very good results, but not consistantly enough for $500 when there is a better alternative out there (in my opinion). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Excellent camera for those times when you don't want to be lugging around a real camera, such as airline travel, going to the theater or museum, going to dinner, etc. Excellent glass as expected from Nikon. Produces first class images. Has P, A, S, M exposure modes, plus exposure compensation controls. Lens zoom range covers just about any situation. Has fill flash with compensation controls. Compared with P5100/P6000, has more functions moved to dials and buttons, and away from the menus, which I prefer. Has manual focus, but this feature is probably too cumbersome to use in a street situation.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm giving this camera only 4 stars due to the built-in flash does not work and I will be taking to a Nikon authorized repair dealer to look at the camera per Nikon technical support. I have used the camera without flash and so far am happy with the photos. My favorite thing about the camera is all of the buttons on top and how easy it is to change settings using these buttons. I also have enjoyed the lens zooming to 200.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great all round compact camera. I bought this as a back-up when the size of my D3S isn't feasible. Extremely usable focal length and the option to shoot raw make it a real winner. While it doesn't quite have the tough as a brick feel like my D3S (then again, how many cameras really do?) I'm so used to holding (this may in part, be due to the fact that it's much lighter!), the overall build quality is exceptional, especially for it's price point. Picture IQ is excellent, with a magnitude of different settings/variables available to take your shots with - many of which are accessible via dials/buttons externally, instead of searching for them in a menu (it really makes a difference when shooting in the field). My conclusion? Highly recommended main camera for the enthusiast/pro-sumer ... photographer, or a back-up camera for when the sheer size/weight of a DSLR/lens isn't practical. For the market this camera is aimed at, it really doesn't get much better. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Small / Compact; Large Clear LCD
Cons: Poor autofocus; Poor build; Poor Image Quality; Poor lens
Let me make it clear: this is a real-world review, based on my personal opinions (right or wrong) and on visual evaluations of the files. No test charts involved here, no MTF measurements. As for the photographs, they are out-of-camera jpgs (I don't shoot RAW anymore, so I'm not interested) viewed on a calibrated LaCie 321 monitor. This review only refers to the specimen in my possession. Keep in mind that my approach to the P7000 is deeply biased by my two-years positive experience with the Canon G10. Therefore as soon as I unboxed the Nikon I could't help noticing that it weighs less than it looks. I was expecting a sturdy and rugged unit like the Canon ... . As a matter of fact most authoritative experts and reviewers have pointed up in the last weeks that the P7000 is almost a clone of its rival Canon G11, since both share the same sensor and size, as well as most features and specifications. Somebody even ironically calls it "Powershot P7000". The lesser weight is easily explained: whereas the top and the front plates are metal made, the bottom and the back are pure plastic (I know, it should be called "polycarbonate"). Fact is that despite its semipro-compact ambitions, the P7000 definitely feels plasticky. The three knobs on the top don't click firmly enough and tend to get inadvertently rotated, the wheelpad on the back is flimsier than in a $ 200 point&shoot and the battery/card compartment cover is simply shameful. Briefly a very good design, both ergonomically and aesthetically (the camera is indeed goodlooking), spoilt by inadequate materials and manufacturing. Paradoxically, the P7000 lacks the gorgeous ruggedness of the Nikon pro and semipro DSLRs, and inherits the poor and unreassuring tactile experience of the Canon semipro and entry-level ones. As soon as the "on" button is pressed, the unit is ready to shoot. And the 921.000 dots lcd monitor is a real treat: big, clear and crisp enough to venture a picture evaluation. Menus are well organized and easily understood, as usual at Nikon's. Nothing to do with the insane and obscure literature found in Canon's G series. The viewfinder is definitely more accurate than the one of my G10, but the latter is bigger and slightly clearer. The three control knobs are clever and very well positioned. Especially the exposure compensation dial: your forefinger and thumb naturally "fall" on it, making the expose-to-the-right job an easy task. By the way, whereas the istogram remains visible after focusing, the (very welcome) electronic spirit level inexplicably disappears. I don't know about you, but I definitely don't have a steady hand, so I'd find a permanent level really helpful. I hope this issue will be addressed in an upcoming firmware update. Speaking of focus, the P7000 has big troubles in focusing on bright sunny surfaces, even when they are well textured. In my one-day test, I experienced at least one focus failure over eight attempts. Three times the LCD screen got gray and a warning appeared to advice me that the lens was getting re-initialized. I have never seen anything like that before. It's a fault that Nikon MUST take care of. All the more so because, this shortcoming apart, the P7000 would be a fast and reactive camera, very suitable for street photography. What about picture quality? A camera is all about taking photographs, after all. Well, the Nikon P7000 delivers too contrasty images with a low noise level. In my opinion (I'm not an engineer) the overcontrast is due to an inherent lack of dynamic range. I noticed that the exposure meter has serious troubles in keeping the highlights within the clipping threshold. In other words, to avoid highlights burning, I had to underexpose (up to 1 IL and more) most of the shots I took during the test, whereas the G10 easily managed the same shots with no tweaking. Of course the underexposure caused a severe darkening of the lowlights. As I said, noise is low enough, and has that pleasant... expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon 9817 Black Leather Case for P7000
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight; Compact; Durable
Cons: None
I was surprised at first because the case was shipped flat. But after I took it off the cardboard display piece that is used to hang it on a rack at a camera store I was able to form it into shape and the camera fit perfectly. I had lens armour on the front and a screen protector on the back and it accomodated it perfectly. It is made of nice material, looked nice and for me, it was the perfect way to carry around my little Nikon P7000.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I normally shoot a D300 but needed a small camera to put in my pocket. Very happy with the P7000. No real learning curve going from a Nikon DSLR to this. The LCD is great, very sharp.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: CoolPix P7000 Digital Camera by Nikon
Item.Review: Lots to learn, but that means there are many options available. I'm not entirely happy with the zoom, I thought it was a little longer range, but the indoor photos are GREAT and so is the close up feature. There are so many different options for scenes... night, portrait, sports, beach, indoor- just to name a few.. the list is LONG and each one seems to help! Battery life, so far is good. (Battery and charger are INCLUDED which is a PLUS!)... and buying a spare battery always allows you to have power on hand!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: There is a P7100 version at twice the price, but it is not avaiable yet. This one fits the P7100 perfectly. So buy this one now. It has a leather exterior except for the body area under the front flap which is a black quilted fabric. The interior is a soft fabric. The clasps are 2 magnets embedded inside the flap cover. It attaches to your belt with a 2 leather loop. There is a small SD card pouch on the rear side of the interior. A well made, attractively finished product. Hard to beleive it is only [$]. it's successor is $38. It is ideal for carrying the camera with you. It is just a carrying case, not a camera bag.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a full featured point and shoot camera type of camera with a viewfinder, as I shoot a lot of scenery and wildlife while backpacking in the mountains. DSLR's are too bulky to haul around and LCD screens tend to wash out in bright light. This camera is the best of both worlds, compact, has superior zoom capabilities, along with HD video.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small / Compact; Great HD movies; Great Zoom; Good Image Quality; Full Viewfinder; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Overly complex; Not intuitive
Keep the manual handy in both the camera-bag and at the computer. This camera tries to do it all in a very small package. I found that there was a long learning curve and, after 9 months, there are still capabilities that I don't or can't use.
It should still be possible to select f-stops greater than f-8, but you cannot. It does work remarkably well in low-light and night situations, even under auto-modes. The small size is both a distinct advantage, and a curse. It is small enough to shoot inobtrusively and candidly but hard to adjust on-the-fly for optimal depth-of-field and image quality. It does try to compensa ... te with user-settable pre-set criteria.
All-in-all, a remarkable photo-engineering feat that has not failed me yet, except that I have purchased 4 separate factory supplied 3-rd party IR remote controls and none worked. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have owned Nikon products since the late 1960's. I have Nikon DSLR equipment, but wanted something by Nikon which I could take to work everyday; a small, yet full-featured Nikon. This P7000 has met or exceeded all my expectations. I take it with me everywhere I can, and am shooting a lot more than I was with the heavier and bulkier DSLR cameras. Any suboptimal photos are the result of operator error - not the camera. It is certainly worthy of the Nikon name.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera as an auxiliary to my Nikon D80. I am planning on going to some third world countries where weilding a large and expensive DSLR may not be the smartest thing to do. So far, the P7000 has fit that role well. It is compact and stores easily in a jacket pocket. Power-on time is good and I haven't experienced the slow AF that some others have commented on. However, I mainly shoot landscapes, so that isn't a big problem. File write times when shooting JPEG Fine + RAW are slow, but again I mainly photograph stationary objects. When shooting in JPEG Fine alone, write times are reasonable. I really dig the 5 shot bracket capability and the fact that once the bracket is set and the shutter pressed, all 5 shots occur quickly and without having to press the shutter for ea ... ch shot. I have processed a series of bracketed shots into very impressive HDR's. All in all, a great camera and I am happy with the decision to go with the P7000. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is versatile and very easy to use. In fact, a friend and I recently took pictures of an event. She had a very expensive DSLR camera and I had to send her my images because they were so much better. Nice price, too!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Took camera right out of box to family reunion. Beats carrying my DSLR and a couple of lenses. Was up and shooting immediately. Received many positive comments on the picture quality and color vibrancy. Great sub for my DSLR.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: For carrying the camera around it works good. It's a little bulky due to the size of the camera, so if you wear your shirt over your belt worn camera, you'll have rather large bulge there. I would only recommend two things to make this case better, put a small pouch on the end of the case to hold a spare battery (better yet, one on each end!) and the inside of the case is big enough for more than one SD card pocket, how about 2, 3, or even 4 pockets?

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have used Nikon for years. I have a D70, D300, and D2X. I have now retired and was looking for a small camera that would perform. I am simply doing fun photography these days and needed a camera that I could carry with me at all times. I have found the P7000 to be just what I was looking for. The price was good and the quality has been great. I plan to purchase another one for my daughter. So far it has met my expecations. It not as fast as the D300 but the size makes up for it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I REALLY want to love this camera
Item.Review: As the title reads, I really want to love this camera, but its AF is turning into a deal breaker. After downloading the latest firmware, and hoping for an improvement, it's just not there. In anything but ideal lighting conditions, I continue to experience hit or miss AF. The firmware did take care of the lens error message, but it did not address the P7000's lack of AF ability. I absolutely love the camera's slew of manual buttons (although it's crying out for a dedicated ISO dial), even the aesthetic appeal of its rangefinder-like appearance. I already own a D90, so I was looking forward to using my SB-400 and IR remote. I e-mailed Nikon regarding the AF issues and their response was lackluster, best summarized by reminding me I have a 1 year warranty. Thanks. I read reviews of th ... is camera before I purchased so I was aware of the slow menus and general slow navigability, potential sticking lens cover and AF issues. I haven't experienced the sticking lens cover, and I can live with the slow UI. I suppose I just didn't fully accept the AF issues that I read about and was hoping they were overblown. Unfortunately they are not. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Nearly sent this camera back after my initial few shots because of the known tweeks in the original firmware. Downloaded the new version 1.1 right online from Nikon and this camear turned into a dream machine. It's macro capabilities is mind blowing. Picture quality with the expeed2 sensor is amazingly good! Before purchasing just call and make sure the one they send you is with the current firmware and you're good to go! BEST Coolpix I've ever used by far!!! Once you buy it, you won't put it down!!!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I just received the camera about a week ago from this write up and so far have taking it to a photoshoot at the beach. I am really pleased with the results. Picture quality is very good (excellent when compared to other point and shoot) I think that for the price it was an excellent buy.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've wanted a smaller format camera for those times when I don't want the extra overhead of carrying my normal D300 or D70 systems. The ability to shoot in RAW mode, spot metering, high video resolution, compact size, multiple shooting modes, and a wide optical zoom range were all individual requirements. I was willing to sacrifice one or two of those features, but with the P7000, I didn't have to sacrifice anything. Combine that with almost no shutter lag, this is perfect. Not only is this my casual shooting camera, it has also found a spot in my regular setup for those times where I just want to grab a quick shot and most of the gear is still packed up. Very good price, and an excellent feature set.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
Item.Review: I like the excellent picture quality and the good zoom range. The macro range is ok for me because I don't take pictures of very small objects. Focussing was sometimes problematic especially in the very near distance. A firmware update helped to improve the focussing.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We use this camera for many things from sporting events, shcool shows, outdoor, indoor, low light, long distances and so far I have not be let down one time. Great size, good battery, picture quality, and zoom.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: i like the camera,feels good and the position of fucntion controls has good quality feeling. still keeping my eyes open for a new point and shoot with a little bigger sensor and more zoom with the quality of pictures i'm getting with this coolpix.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Remember those cases that wrapped around the camera and flipped down so you could take the shot. This case is as close as you will get for the P7000. Fit is OK, given the leather will stretch a little in use. Protection is adequate unless it's raining. I'd add a couple of features if I was the supplier. One, a way of retaining the case to the camera when taking photos and two, a pull over waterproof cover. Then it would get 5 stars.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Purchased to replace a Canon G11 I kicked under a car. Bought to use an SB400 flash because the one thing Canon can't get right is flash. Controls are hard to use and ergonomics is not good. You reset the exposure compensation on almost a daily basis. Picture quality is fine but it is such a slow camera to use that it is almost useless. Slow focus, slow processing time, slow recycle, if speed is an issue, stay away from this. Nikon just can't seem to get point and shoot right. (I use only Nikon DSLR's... D70, D200, D300, D700, D2, D2H)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great When You Don't Have Your DSLR
Item.Review: I bought this to be my camera that is always in my car and when I don't have my DSLR with me. Good little thing! It provides MASP control and you can keep files in RAW format. Good LCD screen on the back!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Was looking for a camera with a view finder option so I didn't have to rely on rear display in bright light. Nice surprise, P7000 fits the bill and provides capability you would only expect from a higher end SLR. Battery life is great, solid performance in low light. Remarkable amount of flexibility. Strongly recommended.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera to use between my D50 and CoolPix 230. I wanted some of the features on a DSLR and a point and shoot. Now I grab the P7000 instead of one of the others as it takes as good or better pictures as the D50 and is much faster and takes much better pictures than the 230. I am still learning to use all the features. I would give this camera at lest 6 stars!!! It is expensive but every cent!!!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Ideal Light Weight Full Featured Camera
Item.Review: I am planning a trip with my wife to South Africa with a couple day stop in Amsterdam. I did not want to have a heavy camera with multiple lenses to keep up with so decided on the P7000 because of the many features and ease of use. It is great for close up shots as well as ones taken at a reasonable distance. So far the photos I have taken are excellant and the clarity is superb. I will have a few months to experiment and learn prior to the trip. I hope to have many recorded photos during this trip of a lifetime. DM

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The bottom line is that this camera may have taken me out of the DSLR market. Compared to the compacts that I have been shooting with, the images are stunning. It does an amazing job in low light situations. The shutter lag is indiscernable. It fits in my pants pocket. It has bracketing (3 or 5 shots) which manufacturers have taken out of the lower end models. It can shoot RAW. My only reservation is the limited optical zoom of 7X. Great camera!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: TOO MUCH WHIZ AND NOT ENOUGH BANG
Item.Review: I AM AN ADVANCED PHOTO ENTHUSIAST AND HAVE USED DSL, DIGITAL DSL, AND POINT AND SHOOT CAMERAS FOR 60 YEARS AND THIS IS THE MOST DISAPPOINTING CAMERA I HAVE EVER PURCHASED. TO MANY MEANINGLESS FUNCTIONS THAT WORK IN ONLY CERTAIN MODES. THE ZOOM AND FOCUS IS SLOW AND ERRATIC. SOME TIMES THE FOCUS AND ZOOM WILL NOT FUNCTION UNLESS CAMERA IS TURNED OFF THEN BACK ON. NIKON TRIED TO PUT TO MUCH INTO WHAT IS JUST ANOTHER POINT AND SHOOT.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Don't think of it as backup
Item.Review: I purchased this camera as a backup to my Nikon D3, to have with me for the just in case shot. Unfortunately, while its image is sharp, the lag time for the shutter is very, very long. The controls are also not well thought out, requiring constant checking with the instruction manual

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love this camera, I'm always with camera the p7000 has the compact size of a point and shoot and many of the features of the bulky SLR. When I don't feel like the bulk of the SLR the p7000 is with me. The sensor is above the point and shoots and it has the option of RAW and JPEG.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for!
Item.Review: I was looking for a camera that I could carry with me most of the time. I found that P&S camera were too limiting and that my smallest DSLR was too big. This camera was perfect. It has the options of a bigger SLR and the smaller size of a Large P&S. It has a ton of shooting sizes and all the regular shooting modes. Most of the shooting options can be managed from the exterior dials without going in to the menu's.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have been carrying this camera everywhere. If your use to film camera's you will be right at home with this one. I love all of the easy to adjust dials and the user settings that make it fun to use. I did have to upgrade the firmware when I first got it but that is easy and on the Nikon web site. The camera is a little slow to turn on but once it is on the shutter is snappy. This will be the camera I bring with when I don't feel like carrying my SLR kit around.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: BH Sure it's smaller and easier to carry. But it isn't so small that it easily fits in your pocket. The results I've gotten and the quality of the optics are wonderful. After all, it's a Nikon. And for that, I'm satisfied. I use it for interior architectural shots and use a bounce flash which the hot-shoe accommodates well. I'll have to wait until the wide angle adapter is available to duplicate the shots I get with my Nikon SLR. Just like a cop with a back-up revolver, the P7000 is a trusted tool that can be depended upon.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: What is really interesting about this camera is that Nikon has thought through how you use a portable camera in the field. A lot of using a small camera like this is to be able to travel light and shoot fast. What I want is instant access to just the control I need. Nikon provides this opportunity with the ability to customize your own shooting setting for instant access. When you get don configuring all the custom settings you have defined your own personal work flow. It's really cool. When they said the CoolPix P 7000 has a low light shooting adjustment, hey there were not kidding. Hard to know what is just promotional hype these days so I kind of ignored it. But this is real. You really can shoot in available light far more often than I could with my old camera. Great feature.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: With my owning 2 SLR's (Canon and Nikon), my expectations of the Nikon P7000 were a quality point-and-shoot, although of lesser quality than my true SLR's. Surprisingly, image quality, manual control, flash and format (SD/SDHC etc.) compatibility are peceptibly equivalent to comparable focal length DSLRs that I own. Bit of a learning curve in mastering the Menu system, although much the same as that of my Nikon DSLR. Onboard flash superior to any other I've come across! Problems cited by other reviewers appear to be corrected with Firmware (1.1) update, which I immediately applied. Complaints: None, except perhaps would be nice if HD video were 1080i/p and true AVCHD, rather than 720p MOV fomat.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is wonderful. I normally carry a D90 with various lenses. This is a pro camera in a point and shoot box. Controls are at your fingertips when changing exposure, F-Stop and ISO. I take it everywhere so I do not miss those picture moments.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this with a P7100. The Bower tube adapter fit well and seemed to be of very good quality (metal). I gave this 4 stars if you intend to use it to protect the lens when it is extended. Adding filters to this will cause vignetting at wider angle settings. I would like to see the outer section flare out so that larger filters could be added, minimizing or reducing vignetting.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon P7000 amazing camera for the money
Item.Review: This camera is a bulletproof little point and shoot that takes top-quality images. It's compact in size and the metal body make it the perfect camera for my rock climbing adventures. I'm very happy with it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: serious amateur photography. It is one great camera. The scene mode is outstanding. The Coolpix P7000 is a super value for the features it has. As of yet, I havent really found anything that I dont like about it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not what I had hoped for
Item.Review: I was delighted when Nikon came out with a high end P&S with a viewfinder. I was looking for a small lightweight camera to throw in my bag when I wasn't taking my larger cameras with me (I was missing too many shots that I would have loved to have gotten and other pro friends recommended a good P&S to have with me at all times). I have been very disappointed. Outdoor scenic shots are OK but indoor shots are not. Focus is slow and irregular in what it chooses to focus on. Shutter is temperamental. I can be shooting in the same light, at the same distance, with the same settings and get entirely different shots in terms of focus, WB and exposure. This purchase was a mistake!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Originally purchased to replace my Canon G10, I wanted higher ISO with less noise, which the Nikon and Canon G12 both deliver. On the Nikon P7000, I was disappointed in:1. Pop-up flash2. Four steps required to change ISO, as opposed to one on the Canon G123. Color balance/processing-just never quite right4. On-screen menu adjustments, as opposed to quick adjustments on the Canon, without scrolling through on-screen menus.[...]

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good camera, but not for everyone
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Good Image Stabilization; Great Zoom; Large Clear LCD; Easy To Use; Nice Body Color; Good in Low Light
OK, first of all, the combo is good for the price at the time I bought it (mid October). Overall, everything seems useful except for camera case, which fits the camera too tightly thus makes it difficult to insert/remove the camera in a flash.
This camera produces images with quality that rivals even the entry-level DSLRs such as the Nikon D40 (my first DSLR) in a much more portable package, and even more if you consider the available zoom range. The high ISO images are better than the Nikon D40 can achieve at ISO 800.
The camera body contains enough knobs for manual control of exposure, shooting mode, and various settings that make using i ... t a joy, but only if you are familiar with an DSLR camera before. For people wanting to get a good & easy to use point-and-shoot camera, this is not it. But for previous DSLR owners, this is fantastic as a backup and/or travel camera. The build quality is typical of Nikon DSLR, not point and shoot cameras.
There are quite a few complaints on the net about the issues such as slow .NRW writing speed, lens focus error re-initialization, etc. My own experiences confirm these issues, but I belive their impacts largely depend on personal shooting preferences.
Overall, a fantastic supplemental camera for DSLR owners. The firmware could use some improvements. Top IQ & ergonomic in its camera class. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I love, love, love my new Nikon P7000
Item.Review: I bought the P7000 for my travel camera rather than carrying my Nikon D700 and long lenses. I love the small size, great optics and all the features as on my D700 but in a small package.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: As a substitute to carrying a D-SLR this camera has just enough going for it. I wouldn't employ this as a back-up camera. However, with the ease this light weight and capable unit I've gotten back to carrying a camera most everywhere I go. The lens is sharp enough with good contrast. It also sports a very useful range. And as long as light levels don't get too low it will rival it's larger and more capable brethren.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Nice form factor, The viewfinder is a extra.. but not that useful It would be nice if they could include that at some point Manual setting is excellent aperture priority works fine shutter speed priority is.. kinda junk.. You can get super under/over exposed, and there isn't an under exp/over exp indicator in this mode (that i could find) there's just a blinking box that indicates wrong,try again : / The super tiny flash is rather impressive. It produces nice clean fills without the harsh effects you would think a flash will produce I like the quality of the photos, and the form factor of the camera. If you want something that takes sharp pictures and can deal with the loss of exposure priority, then its a really nice compact photo companion.. Manual,AP, and the various autos ar ... e available I recommend the software photo matrix as something to buy if you havent yet. NH expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A step up from the P6000
Item.Review: My P6000 was stolen late this summer, and I was down in the dumps until I saw the new P7000 offered. Bought it immediately, and glad I did. It is a great little P&S, and finally comparable to the G11/12. Added telephoto length is a plus. New and easier to use menu controls. I am a Nikon DSLR shooter, but need a small P&S for scouting and traveling. Compatible with Nikon speedlites and remote, it is a great addition to the camera bag. And easy enough to hand off to someone else to shoot on their own.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: All the cameras i have had were a good ones: SLR`s asahi pentax spotmatic and nikon E70, both with many accesories. My first point and shot camera was coolpix 7900, also great. But using this one, I wear it in my trousers pocket, I can`t thing in buying other one (D7000 on my mind) for the moment. The only problems I have had were related with the ergonomy. Is very easy to change configuration when you are in a hurry due to some butons place.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I needed a small camera to take hiking, my D70s is very bulky and it was a pain when I went hiking. This camera is great for that. The camera produces very nice images and the controls are very easy to handle. The main problem I have with this camera is that when I go hiking it is very bright and the monitor is useless and it is very hard to read the manual setting information and there is no information given through the viewfinder. Otherwise this is an excellent camera

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Good Image Stabilization; Good Image Quality; Light weight; Great Build Quality; Large Clear LCD
When you don't want to carry your DSLR, this is the camera to take. Image quality was great even in the automatic mode, the 3 inch screen is clear and having an optical viewfinder is a plus. Feels better than the Canon G11 and G12. I'm a D300 and D200 user and this is a great addition.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The adapter tube fits the P7000 perfectly. It does partially obstruct the viewfinder. If you compose using the LCD, it works fine. If you add the tulip lens hood, the viewfinder is nearly totally obstructed. The LCD will be the only way to compose. The tube is metal and well built. It should protect the lens to some degree.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The P7000 exceeded my expectations by a wide margin. Ease of use, semi-compactness and superb optics make it a real pleasure to use. There are so many creative settings that it is hard to decide which to use first.
